text: Is there any way to distinguish between the web version of an email and the one a contact receives in their inbox? Like, if I wanted to add some extra query string to links on the web version that wouldn't be there for email users.

I don’t think there is in HubL, but you might be able to do something with JS, as that will be blocked in an email client but will render in the browser. So you could log whatever HubL value you wanted to a JS variable in a <script> tag then select and add those vars to your link hrefs. I don’t know if that might hurt your spam score though, so I would double-check.
Yeah, seems like it might be a bad idea
